Package Model.Cards

Class MessageCard

java.lang.Object
Model.Cards.MessageCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Card
public class MessageCard extends Object implements Card
Implements the Card Interface and it contains all the data needed for a MessageCard and the methods to access and transform the data
Author:
csd4623

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MessageCard​(String[] info, int cardNumber)
    constructor: Constructs a new MessageCard with the given parameter info and cardNumber
    Precondition: info is not null and contains all the necessary data for the card and cardNumber is between 0 and 47
    postcondition: Creates and initializes a MessageCard with the given info (which is a String[] with the Title, type, value, imagePath, message and 1 choice of the card) and cardNumber (the number of the order of the card on the board).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    getCardNumber()
    accessor: returns the number of the card
    Postcondition: The number has been returned
    String[]
    getInfo()
    accessor: returns the info of the card
    Postcondition: The info has been returned
    String
    getType()
    accessor: returns the type of the card contained in the info eg advertisement, bill, charity, deal(only for deal cards), ...
    Postcondition: The type has been returned
    int
    getValue()
    accessor: returns the value of the card contained in the info
    Postcondition: The value has been returned
    void
    setCardNumber​(int cardNumber)
    transformer: sets the number of the card, the number of the card will basically be the number of the row of the card in the String[][] mailCards of the PayDayCards class
    Precondition: for mail Cards 0<=number<=47
    Postcondition: The number has changed
    void
    setInfo​(String[] info)
    transformer: sets the String[] info of the card, which contains the title, message, type and image and is provided by the PayDayCards class
    Precondition: info is not null and contains all the necessary data for the card
    Postcondition: The message has changed
    String
    toString()
    returns the String representation of the Card
    Postcondition: the String representation of the card has been returned

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • MessageCard

      public MessageCard​(String[] info, int cardNumber)
      constructor: Constructs a new MessageCard with the given parameter info and cardNumber
      Precondition: info is not null and contains all the necessary data for the card and cardNumber is between 0 and 47
      postcondition: Creates and initializes a MessageCard with the given info (which is a String[] with the Title, type, value, imagePath, message and 1 choice of the card) and cardNumber (the number of the order of the card on the board).
      Parameters:
      info - String[] with the Title, type, value, imagePath, message and 1 choice of the card
      cardNumber - the number of the order of the card on the board

  • Method Details

    • setInfo

      public void setInfo​(String[] info)
      transformer: sets the String[] info of the card, which contains the title, message, type and image and is provided by the PayDayCards class
      Precondition: info is not null and contains all the necessary data for the card
      Postcondition: The message has changed
      Specified by:

    • setCardNumber

      public void setCardNumber​(int cardNumber)
      transformer: sets the number of the card, the number of the card will basically be the number of the row of the card in the String[][] mailCards of the PayDayCards class
      Precondition: for mail Cards 0<=number<=47
      Postcondition: The number has changed
      Specified by:
      setCardNumber in interface Card
      Parameters:
      cardNumber -
